channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hard edges not done, 18th August
item.description:
The hard edges of LBB path that leads from Hazelmere road under railway line need to be cut again. This seems to be an annual chase by users ... see 5944924 and others. Please can edges be done quickly as charities and volunteers have just spent time and money to pay for tunnel to be painted with mural. There will be an official 'opening' of the painted tunnel by LBB D Mayor within next few days........D Mayor will be embarrassed walking up to newly painted tunnel through heavily overurn hard edges on approach path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelmere Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle right next to zebra crossing restricting pedestrian's view at crossing this is a hazard and danger., 18th August
item.description:
Abandoned DPD vehicle right next to zebra crossing restricting pedestrian's view at crossing this is a hazard and danger. Has been left for over two months. This is very dangerous for any family or children to use crossing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meynell Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car broke down 10 days ago, 18th August
item.description:
The Mercedes car has been left for 10 days since breaking down Since the disabled bay has been put in the street has less parking for tenants and this mini cab has been left driver was in his mid to late 30s explained it would only be there until it was collected by truck on same day as originally it was dangerously Parked it has since been moved closer to the curb but in an awkward location for all residents now as due to the location only a small car can get behind this and the disabled bay

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DS 5 Construction Flyposter on pavement outside 18 The Fairway, 18th August
item.description:
DS 5 Construction Flyposter on pavement. Please fine this company for littering our streets with their advertising junk. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///over.freed.candle https://w3w.co/over.freed.candle

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Fairway, Southborough, London
